page.title: 07THE BRANT BROUGHTON FESTIVAL
page.content: In 1977 celebrations took place to commemorate the Queen's Silver Jubilee. From this event an annual Festival developed which has continued up to the present. Until this year it was held over the May Bank Holiday Weekend and started with a procession of decorated floats around the village. Judging took place on the village playing field where other attractions were also held. No procession of floats took place this year and the date was also moved back to June. A donkey derby was again held and a dog show also took place. Between 800 and 1000 people normally attend the show and in recent years more people have been attracted from outside the village. The Festival itself is not a fund-raising event, although village organisations can erect stalls if they wish.
